newsitem.title: USA: U.S. spot propane extends gains on cold weather.
newsitem.headline: U.S. spot propane extends gains on cold weather.

text.p: U.S. spot propane prices extended their gains in late trade on Tuesday, largely pushed up by cold weather, players said.
In the Midwest, Conway, Kansas, spot propane edged up another quarter cent, building upon the 1.25 cents gained at midday. Spot material was trading between 54.75 cents and 55.00 cents a gallon.
"It's mostly because of the cold weather in the Midwest," said one Conway trader.
Mont Belvieu, Texas, spot material remained at 52.75/53.00 cents, players said.
Traders said activity was light in the U.S. Gulf Coast because many players left their offices earlier for a conference Wednesday on petrochemical feedstocks.
-- Laney Salisbury, New York Energy Desk +1 212 859 1631
